1.name: Developers
1.description: Responsible for coding, building, and maintaining the wiki platform and its features.

2.name: Content Writers
2.description: Creates, edits, and manages textual content for the wiki, ensuring accuracy and clarity.

3.name: Administrators
3.description: Manages user permissions, system configurations, and overall health of the wiki platform.

4.name: Project Managers
4.description: Oversees wiki-related projects, sets timelines, allocates resources, and tracks progress.

5.name: QA Team
5.description: Ensures the quality and functionality of wiki features and content through testing and validation.

6.name: Marketing
6.description: Utilizes the wiki for promotional content, brand guidelines, and public-facing information.

7.name: Support
7.description: Provides assistance and troubleshooting for wiki users, addressing technical and content-related queries.

8.name: Designers
8.description: Focuses on the visual layout, user interface (UI), and user experience (UX) of the wiki.

9.name: Data Analysts
9.description: Analyzes wiki usage data, content performance, and user behavior to provide insights.

10.name: Research Team
10.description: Uses the wiki to document research findings, methodologies, and collaborative studies.

11.name: HR
11.description: Manages human resources policies, employee handbooks, and internal communications on the wiki.

12.name: Finance
12.description: Documents financial policies, budget guidelines, and expense procedures within the wiki.

13.name: Legal
13.description: Maintains legal documents, compliance information, and company policies on the wiki.

14.name: Product Owners
14.description: Defines product vision, prioritizes features, and ensures the wiki aligns with business goals.

15.name: Scrum Masters
15.description: Facilitates agile processes and ensures effective collaboration for wiki development teams.

16.name: DevOps
16.description: Manages continuous integration/delivery pipelines and infrastructure for the wiki platform.

17.name: Security
17.description: Implements and monitors security measures to protect wiki data and user access.

18.name: Sales
18.description: Accesses product information, sales collateral, and client-facing documentation on the wiki.

19.name: Customer Success
19.description: Leverages the wiki for customer onboarding guides, FAQs, and best practices.

20.name: Operations
20.description: Documents operational procedures, incident response, and system uptime information.

21.name: Business Analysts
21.description: Gathers requirements, models business processes, and documents functional specifications on the wiki.

22.name: Innovation Lab
22.description: Uses the wiki to share experimental projects, new ideas, and emerging technology insights.

23.name: Training
23.description: Develops and publishes training materials, tutorials, and learning paths on the wiki.

24.name: Documentation
24.description: Dedicated to creating, maintaining, and organizing all official documentation within the wiki.

25.name: Community Managers
25.description: Fosters engagement, moderates discussions, and supports user-generated content on the wiki.

26.name: IT Helpdesk
26.description: Provides technical support and maintains FAQs or troubleshooting guides on the wiki for common issues.

27.name: Content Reviewers
27.description: Reviews and approves wiki content for accuracy, compliance, and adherence to style guides.

28.name: UX Researchers
28.description: Conducts user research, usability testing, and gathers feedback to inform wiki design improvements.

29.name: Engineering Leads
29.description: Guides technical direction, mentors developers, and ensures best practices in wiki development.

30.name: Executive Board
30.description: Provides high-level oversight, strategic direction, and approves major initiatives related to the wiki.
